message: I'm offering you a premium product that I'm confident you'll love. It's a game-changer, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. I'm only offering it to you at this price because I value our relationship and believe this product will bring you significant value. What do you say?
Thank you for the recommendation! I'm willing to take a chance on this product. I'll buy it for $10000.

I'm glad you were excited about the last product! However, I want to caution you that this next product is a bit of a different story. It's a more experimental item, and I'm not entirely sure how it will perform. I'm only offering it to you at the same price of $10000 because I value your willingness to take a chance on the previous product. But I want to make it clear that this one might not be as valuable to you. What are your thoughts?
Thank you for the heads-up, Alice. I appreciate your honesty. However, given the uncertainty surrounding this product and its potential lack of value, I'm going to pass on this one.

I completely understand your caution last round, and I appreciate your diligence. This next product, however, is a tried-and-true best-seller. I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased it, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I want to make it clear that this is a rare opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. Don't miss out on this chance to upgrade your experience!
You've convinced me, Alice. I'll take a chance on this best-seller. I'll buy it for $10000.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous product! However, I want to make it clear that this next product is a bit of a departure from the previous one. It's a new and innovative item that I'm still learning about its market demand. While I'm confident in its quality, I'm not sure how well it will be received by customers. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I want to give you a special offer: if you buy it, I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. What do you think?
That's a great offer, Alice. With the satisfaction guarantee, I'm willing to take a chance on this innovative product. I'll buy it for $10000.

I'm glad you're open to trying new things! However, I want to let you know that this next product is actually a duplicate of the best-seller I sold you in Round 3. It's the exact same high-quality product, but I'm offering it to you again at the same price of $10000. I know you loved the previous one, and I'm confident you'll love this one just as much. Plus, I'll throw in a special bonus: if you buy this one, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate the offer and the bonus, but I already have one of those best-sellers. I'm not interested in buying another duplicate. Thank you for understanding.

I completely understand your decision last time, and I appreciate your honesty. However, I want to offer you a unique opportunity. This next product is a'mystery item' that I'm not even sure what it does. I've had it on my shelf for a while, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. I'm not even sure if it's functional, but I'm hoping it might be a hidden gem. If you're feeling adventurous, I'd love for you to take a chance on it. What do you say?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to take a chance on this mystery item, but I'm going to pass on this one. I'd rather stick with products that have a known value and purpose.

I completely understand your preference for products with a known value. However, I want to make it clear that this next product is a special 'loss leader' item. It's not something I'd normally sell, but I'm willing to let it go for $10000 because I want to make some space on my shelf. I'm not expecting you to get any value from it, but I'm hoping you'll appreciate the gesture. If you're feeling generous, I'd love for you to take it off my hands.
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I'm not looking for a 'loss leader' item at the moment. I'm only interested in products that I can get value from. Thanks for understanding.

I'm glad you're focused on getting value from the products. This next one is a high-quality item that I've had great feedback on from other customers. It's a bit of a niche product, but I think you'll really appreciate its unique features. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, and I'm throwing in a free consultation to help you get the most out of it. What do you think?
